nodes.text: The M9 "Boomer" heavy pistol, also known colloquially as the "hand cannon," was a model of slugthrower pistol manufactured by Czerka Arms. It was designed to cram as much killing power as possible into as small a package as possible, and became a standout in the heavy pistol market. The weapon was thick and squat with a large caliber and sold for one thousand credits.

Instead of the standard rounds, the M9 fired fin-stabilized grenades from a box magazine, giving the user respectable anti-personnel capabilities at a medium range. The weapon's downsides included a limited payload, poor accuracy and cumbersome handling. It was used by engineers from both the Alliance to Restore the Republic and the Galactic Empire.
The M9 "Boomer" heavy pistol was first mentioned in Fully Operational, a supplement to Fantasy Flight Games' Star Wars: Age of Rebellion.
